column4: For some reason Firefox is really slow to start loading a page.  The status bar shows "Looking up [doman]..." for a few seconds before the page actually starts to load.   What could be causing this?
or maybe firefox is contacting google to check for known malicious website,  you could disable this function
how would I determine that?  I'm not sure if they're using custom proxies/dns servers in this distro
okay, I'll check that real quick
well, check what dns server you are using in  connection information.  and you try to benchmark it.
you could do simple test like "dig  google.com"   or with a DNS benchmark program like namebench
try to dig some other site, like those you haven't visited recently (last few hours)
and you may want to go firefox preferences->Security -> disable "block reported attack site" and "block reported web forgeries"
those 2 firefox functions would query google everytime you access a website
and after you disable those functions, you may want to remove "urlclassifier3.sqlite" file in your firefox profile folder too
okay, I already disabled those two functions (I'm smart enough not to need them lol).
nope.  For example, heading to facebook.com, the status showed "Looking up facebook.com" for at least 7 seconds before it started to load.
this happens for every link I click on as well.
hmm, this Firefox came preloaded with several extensions.  I'll just try disabling them and see if one of them is causing it.
ah.  I'll try chrome in a few.  I'm installing a bunch of updates right now... maybe they'll fix the issue.
